Package se.arkalix.security.access

Arrowhead Access Control

There are four access control paradigms currently supported by the Arrowhead Framework, which are
  1. access by certificate,
  2. access by white-list,
  3. access by token and
  4. unrestricted access.

The three former paradigms are only supported for systems running in secure mode, while the unrestricted paradigm is the only supported paradigm in insecure mode.

Each Arrowhead system is expected to enforce its access policies when other systems try to consume the services its provide, as well as trying to comply with the access requirements of the services it tries to consume itself.

More details about the access control paradigms can be read in the classes representing them.

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AccessPolicy
    An access control policy.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AccessByCloudCertificate
    Same-cloud access policy.
    AccessByCloudWhitelist
    Same-cloud and whitelist access policy.
    AccessByToken
    Token access policy.
    AccessUnrestricted
    Unrestricted access policy.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    AccessTokenException
    Indicates that something is preventing a given access token from being used to authenticate some consumer.
